message: Hello Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll love. I'm willing to offer it to you for $120.
Hello Alice, I appreciate your offer, but I believe I can find the product elsewhere for a lower price. I am willing to pay $95 for it.
I understand you're looking for a good deal, but I'm not willing to go as low as $95. I can offer you a discount, but I need to make a profit. I'm willing to sell it to you for $110.
Hello Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. I am still interested in purchasing the product, but I would like to stick closer to my initial offer. I am willing to pay $100 for it.
I'm glad you're still interested in the product, Bob. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit. I can sell it to you for $105.
Hello Alice, thank you for considering my previous offers. I am willing to pay $100 for the product, which is within my budget and fair given the value of the item.
I understand you're firm on your price, Bob. However, I've already made a significant concession. I'm willing to sell it to you for $102.50, but that's as low as I can go.
Hello Alice, I appreciate your efforts to accommodate my budget. I am willing to pay $100 for the product, which I believe is a fair price given its value.
I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're not going to come to an agreement, Bob. I'm willing to make one final concession. I can sell it to you for $102, but that's as low as I can go.
Hello Alice, I understand your position and appreciate your efforts to reach an agreement. I am willing to pay $98 for the product, which I believe is a fair price given its value.
